the picture has a chest circumference of 105 5 cm / 41 5 inches and is wearing a size 6 **materials** version 1 merino copenhagen fibers color a 5 5 6 6 7 8 8 9 skeins color 2 color b 5 5 6 6 7 8 8 9 skeins color 7 version 2 merino copenhagen fibers color a 5 5 6 6 7 8 8 9 skeins color 15 color b 5 5 6 6 7 8 8 9 skeins color 13 circular needles 4 mm 40 60 and 80 cm circular needles 3 5 mm 40 and 80 cm double pointed needles 3 5 and 4 mm if using the magic loop method double pointed needles can be omitted 4 stitch markers **yarn quality** merino copenhagen fibers 100% wool 50 g = 108 m **gauge** 21 sts x 31 r = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 inches in 6x6 rib stitch pattern k6 p6 using needles 4 mm always use the needle size that gives you the correct gauge in both height and width measured after washing and blocking **pattern information** the thekla sweater is knitted from the top-down in 6x6 rib with narrow stripes in two colors the shoulders are shaped with increases on both the front and back the shoulder stitches are placed on hold the front and back pieces are worked back and forth before being joined under the armhole to form the body the sleeves are worked in the round across the resting shoulder stitches together with stitches picked up along the armhole **find the pattern in more languages here ** german 1 danish 2 swedish 3 norwegian 4 finnish 5 french 6 spanish
